Properties.ProtectedString:
-- Waits for the child of the specified parent local function WaitForChild(parent, childName) while not parent:FindFirstChild(childName) do parent.ChildAdded:wait() end return parent[childName] end
local EVENING_MINUTES_AFTER_MIDNIGHT = 1070 local ICON_ID = 93664760 local TEXTURE_ID = 93664784 local MESH_ID = 93664805 local URL_PREFIX = 'http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id='
local INTERVAL_BETWEEN_LIGHTNING = 5 local LIGHTNING_RADIUS = 1 local MAX_SHOOTING_DISTANCE = 100 local LIGHTNING_DAMAGE = 30
local MyCharacter local MyLeftArm local MyMouse
local Tool = script.Parent local Handle
local MolecularAtomizer
local LightingService = Game:GetService('Lighting') local DebrisService = Game:GetService('Debris') local PlayersService = Game:GetService('Players')
local OriginalTime local RevertingTimeOfDay = false
local ShootSound
local ShootTrack local IdleTrack
local FreezeTorsoScript
local LightningPart = Instance.new("Part") LightningPart.Name = "Lightning" LightningPart.FormFactor = 3 LightningPart.Size = Vector3.new(1, 1, 10) LightningPart.Anchored = true
local LightningMesh = Instance.new("SpecialMesh") LightningMesh.Scale = Vector3.new(0.6, 0.7, 0.6) LightningMesh.MeshId = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=65419828" LightningMesh.TextureId = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=65419395" LightningMesh.VertexColor = Vector3.new(0.6, 1, 0.85) LightningMesh.Parent = LightningPart
local function WeldToLeftArm(object) if not object or not object.Name then print("Invalid object given to WeldToLeftArm.") return end if not MyLeftArm then print("Cannot weld" , object.Name , "to an arm you don't have.") return nil end local weld = Instance.new('ManualWeld') weld.Part0 = MyLeftArm weld.Part1 = object -- This CFrame data was collected through studio weld.C0 = CFrame.new(0, -1, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0, -1, 0) -- this weld is on right side of left arm --weld.C1 = CFrame.new(0, -0.3, -0.7, 1, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 1) -- this weld is on the top of right arm weld.C1 = CFrame.new(0, -0.3, -0.7, 0, 1, 0, -1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1) weld.Parent = object end
local function CreateMolecularAtomizer() local atomizer = Instance.new('Part') atomizer.FormFactor = Enum.FormFactor.Custom atomizer.Size = Vector3.new(1, 1.6, 1.4) local mesh = Instance.new('SpecialMesh') mesh.MeshId = URL_PREFIX .. MESH_ID mesh.TextureId = URL_PREFIX .. TEXTURE_ID mesh.Parent = atomizer return atomizer end
local function Lerp(start, finish, ratio) ratio = math.min(1, math.max(ratio, 0)) return (1 - ratio) * start + ratio * finish end
-- Think of this circle as one in local space with its normal pointing in the pos-y -- so, if we use the points from this circle function we need to remember to rotate the return values -- into the world-space circle that we want local function PointOnCircle(originX, originZ, radius, theta) local X = originX + radius * math.cos(theta) local Z = originZ + radius * math.sin(theta) return X, Z end
local function CreateLightningOutline(character) wait(0.5) for i = 1, 5 do if not character then print("No character to outline") return end for _, child in pairs(character:GetChildren()) do if child:IsA('Part') then local selectionBox = Instance.new('SelectionBox') DebrisService:AddItem(selectionBox, 0.1) selectionBox.Adornee = child selectionBox.Transparency = 0.3 selectionBox.Parent = child end end wait(0.3) end end
-- It is conceptually easier to construct the lightning beam pointing up along -- the pos-y axis and then rotate each point by the direction vector local function CreateLightningBeam(start, direction, distance) local boltList = {} distance = math.min(MAX_SHOOTING_DISTANCE, math.max(distance, INTERVAL_BETWEEN_LIGHTNING)) direction = direction.unit local orientationCFrame = CFrame.new(Vector3.new(), direction.unit) * CFrame.Angles(0, -math.pi / 2, math.pi / 2) for i = 1, distance / INTERVAL_BETWEEN_LIGHTNING do local currOrigin = Vector3.new(0, INTERVAL_BETWEEN_LIGHTNING, 0) * i local nextOrigin = Vector3.new(0, INTERVAL_BETWEEN_LIGHTNING, 0) * (i + 1) local rotationRandomness = math.random() * math.pi / 2 for j = 1, 4 do local currX, currZ = PointOnCircle(currOrigin.x, currOrigin.z, LIGHTNING_RADIUS, (math.pi / 2) * j + rotationRandomness) local nextX, nextZ = PointOnCircle(nextOrigin.x, nextOrigin.z, LIGHTNING_RADIUS, (math.pi / 2) * (j+1) + rotationRandomness) local currBolt = Instance.new('Part') currBolt.Anchored = true currBolt.Size = Vector3.new(0.2, 0.2, INTERVAL_BETWEEN_LIGHTNING * 1.2) currBolt.CanCollide = false currBolt.Transparency = math.min(1, (math.random() + 0.5) / 2 + 0.08) table.insert(boltList, currBolt) local currPoint = Vector3.new(currX, currOrigin.Y, currZ) local nextPoint = Vector3.new(nextX, nextOrigin.Y, nextZ) -- Adjust because the part is centered in the middle not the tip currPoint = currPoint + ((nextPoint - currPoint).unit * (currBolt.Size.Y / 2)) currPoint = (orientationCFrame * currPoint) + start nextPoint = (orientationCFrame * nextPoint) + start currBolt.CFrame = CFrame.new(currPoint, nextPoint) * CFrame.Angles(0, 0, -math.pi / 2) LightningMesh:Clone().Parent = currBolt DebrisService:AddItem(currBolt, 1.6) currBolt.Parent = Workspace end end for i = 1, 5 do Spawn(function() for k, v in pairs(boltList) do if v then if k % 4 == 0 then wait(0.05) end v.Transparency = v.Transparency / 3 end end end) Delay(0.1, function() for k, v in pairs(boltList) do if v then if k % 4 == 0 then wait(0.05) end v.Transparency = v.Transparency * 3 end end end) wait(0.3) end end
local function ChangeTimeToEvening() if RevertingTimeOfDay then return end OriginalTime = LightingService:GetMinutesAfterMidnight() for i = 0, 1, 0.01 do if RevertingTimeOfDay then break end LightingService:SetMinutesAfterMidnight(Lerp(OriginalTime, EVENING_MINUTES_AFTER_MIDNIGHT, i)) wait(0.02) end end
-- Everyone likes Braid local function RevertTimeBack() if RevertingTimeOfDay then return end RevertingTimeOfDay = true local currTime = LightingService:GetMinutesAfterMidnight() for i = 0, 1, 0.01 do LightingService:SetMinutesAfterMidnight(Lerp(currTime, OriginalTime, i)) wait(0.02) end RevertingTimeOfDay = false end
function OnButton1Up()
end
function OnEquipped(mouse) Handle = WaitForChild(Tool, 'Handle') Handle.Transparency = 1 MyCharacter = Tool.Parent ShootSound = WaitForChild(Handle, 'ShootSound') MyLeftArm = WaitForChild(MyCharacter, 'Left Arm') MyHumanoid = WaitForChild(MyCharacter, 'Humanoid') IdleTrack = MyHumanoid:LoadAnimation(WaitForChild(Tool, 'IdleGvM')) if IdleTrack then IdleTrack:Play() end ShootTrack = MyHumanoid:LoadAnimation(WaitForChild(Tool, 'Shoot2GvM')) MyMouse = mouse if MyMouse then MyMouse.Button1Up:connect(OnButton1Up) end wait(0.1) MolecularAtomizer = CreateMolecularAtomizer() WeldToLeftArm(MolecularAtomizer) FreezeTorsoScript = WaitForChild(Tool, 'FreezeTorso') MolecularAtomizer.Parent = Tool ChangeTimeToEvening() end
function OnUnequipped() Handle.Transparency = 0 if ShootTrack then ShootTrack:Stop() end if IdleTrack then IdleTrack:Stop() end if MolecularAtomizer then -- Destroying sets the parent which can be problematic if -- in the same call stack the unequip function is setting the parent to be Backpack or workspace wait(0.1) MolecularAtomizer:Destroy() MolecularAtomizer = nil end RevertTimeBack() end
function Blow(hit) if hit then print("blow:" , hit.Name) end if hit and hit.Parent and hit.Parent:FindFirstChild('Humanoid') then local character = hit.Parent local hum = character.Humanoid -- Make sure it is an NPC -- if the character has no player then it is an npc if not PlayersService:GetPlayerFromCharacter(character) then if (hit.CFrame.p - MolecularAtomizer.CFrame.p).magnitude < MAX_SHOOTING_DISTANCE then -- uncomment if you want to deal damage -- Delay(1.4, function() if hum then hum:TakeDamage(LIGHTNING_DAMAGE) end end) if FreezeTorsoScript then local freezeTorsoCopy = FreezeTorsoScript:Clone() freezeTorsoCopy.Parent = hit.Parent freezeTorsoCopy.Disabled = false end coroutine.resume(coroutine.create(CreateLightningOutline), hit.Parent) end else print("Is a Player.") end else print("Not a character") end end
local Attacking = false function OnActivate() -- Engage lightning blasters if Attacking or not MyHumanoid or MyHumanoid.Health <= 0 then return end Attacking = true Tool.Enabled = false
if MyMouse then local hitPos = MyMouse.Hit.p if MyMouse.Target then Blow(MyMouse.Target) if FreezeTorsoScript and MyCharacter then local freezeTorsoCopy = FreezeTorsoScript:Clone() freezeTorsoCopy.Parent = MyCharacter freezeTorsoCopy.Disabled = false end else print('no target') end if ShootTrack then ShootTrack:Play() end wait(0.2) if ShootSound then ShootSound:Play() end wait(0.2) --[[ Spawn(function() for i = 1, 3 do local currTime = LightingService:GetMinutesAfterMidnight() LightingService:SetMinutesAfterMidnight(600) wait(0.1) LightingService:SetMinutesAfterMidnight(currTime) wait(0.1) end end) --]] CreateLightningBeam(MolecularAtomizer.CFrame.p, (hitPos - MolecularAtomizer.CFrame.p), (hitPos - MolecularAtomizer.CFrame.p).magnitude) end wait(2) Tool.Enabled = true Attacking = false end
Tool.Equipped:connect(OnEquipped) Tool.Unequipped:connect(OnUnequipped) Tool.Activated:connect(OnActivate)

Tool = script.Parent
local stillEquipped = false
function onEquippedLocal(mouse) stillEquipped = true if mouse == nil then print("Mouse not found") return end while stillEquipped do print("Setting Mouse to go") mouse.Icon = "rbxasset://textures\\GunCursor.png" while Tool.Enabled and stillEquipped do wait(0.01) end print("Setting Mouse to wait") mouse.Icon = "rbxasset://textures\\GunWaitCursor.png" while not Tool.Enabled and stillEquipped do wait(0.01) end end end
function onUnequippedLocal() stillEquipped = false end
Tool.Equipped:connect(onEquippedLocal) Tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequippedLocal)

local MyCharacter = script.Parent local MyTorso = MyCharacter:FindFirstChild('Torso')
if MyTorso then MyTorso.Anchored = true end
wait(1.6)
if MyTorso then MyTorso.Anchored = false end
script:Destroy()
